'Lausanne' () is a city in Romandy, the French-speaking part of Switzerland, and
is the capital of the canton of Vaud. The seat of the district of Lausanne, the
city is situated on the shores of Lake Geneva (). It faces the French
town of Ãvian-les-Bains, with the Jura mountains to its north-west. Lausanne is
located northeast of Geneva.

Lausanne has a population (|lc=on}}) of , making it the fourth largest city of
the country, with the entire agglomeration area having 336,400 inhabitants. [http://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/portal/en/index/themen/01/02/bl-
ank/key/raeumliche_verteilung/agglomerationen.html Swiss Federal Statistical
Office : Population Size and Population Composition : Agglomerations : Permanent
Resident Population in Urban and Rural Areas] The Metropolitan Area of Lausanne-
Geneva is over 1.2 million inhabitants. The headquarters of the International
Olympic Committee (IOC) are located in Lausanne â the IOC officially recognizes
the city as the Olympic Capital â as are the headquarters of the
Court of Arbitration for Sport. It lies in the middle of a wine-growing region.
The city has a 28-station metro system, making it the smallest city in the world
to have a rapid transit system.
categories: Cultural property of national significance in Vaud
